Html:
I have multiple overlays with markers. When I hover over a marker in overlay[0] it is partially hidden by the markers in overlay[1]. How can I set these to be the top most.

Thanks!!
use one overlay or reverse the order

If I reverse the order I will have the same problem with the tool tips on the other layer and I use 2 overlays because one overlay changes all the time and the other I only fill once and it stays the same. So I was very happy that I had that option.

Given that I want to use the overlays as I have them. Is there a way when the tooltip is rendered that I can force it on top.

Sent from my iPhone
dunno, objects are rendered in sequence, check the source and try something ;/

I seem to be having this same issue....
It does not matter which comes first the tooltip will still not be fully visible.

I have found out what my issue has been and I may have to revert to creating a custom tooltip to fix.
I need to be able to turn off the transparency or opacity feature in the tooltip.

I have added this code to change the color, but in the main code has some sort of opacity level.
marker.ToolTip.Fill = new SolidBrush(Color.White);
